intro: Sarcoglottis degranvillei, commonly known as the De Granville's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used as a starchy food source in some cultures. Its leaves are typically large and arrow-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in an inflorescence. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
